content:
Manchester City has a busy schedule this month, with several Premier League matches and a Champions League fixture. Here are their upcoming games for November:

**Premier League:**

* Saturday, November 6: Manchester City vs. Fulham (12:30 PM ET) - Etihad Stadium
* Saturday, November 13: Manchester City vs. Everton (10:00 AM ET) - Etihad Stadium
* Saturday, November 27: Manchester City vs. West Ham United (10:00 AM ET) - Etihad Stadium

**Champions League:**

* Wednesday, November 24: Manchester City vs. Paris Saint-Germain (3:00 PM ET) - Etihad Stadium (Group Stage, Matchday 5)

Please note that the schedule is subject to change, and you should check the official Manchester City website or your local TV listings for the most up-to-date information.

Manchester City is currently in a strong position in the Premier League, sitting in second place behind Chelsea. They've had a good run of form recently, winning their last three league matches. In the Champions League, they're also doing well, topping their group with 9 points from 4 matches.

If you're interested in watching any of these matches, you can check your local TV listings or streaming services like NBC Sports, Peacock, or Paramount+ in the US, or BT Sport in the UK.
